text: The Ven Benedict George Hoskyns MA (23 February 1856 – 11 September 1935) was an eminent Anglican priest in the first third of the 20th century.National Archives He was born on 23 February 1856 into an ennobled family: his father was Canon Sir John Leigh Hoskyns, 9th Bart.thePeerage.com"Who was Who" 1897–2007 London, A & C Black, 2007 He was educated at Bradfield, Haileybury and Jesus College, Cambridge, where he graduated BA in 1878.UNIVERSITY INTELLIGENCE . The Leeds Mercury (Leeds, England), Saturday, 11 June 1887; Issue 15343 He rowed in the 1877 Boat Race, notable for being the only dead heat in the race's history. He was ordained in 1880 and was Curate of St Mary's, Southampton until 1888. He was then Vicar of St Denys in the same city”The Clergy List” London, Hamilton & Co 1889 until 1895, and also Chaplain to the 2nd Volunteer Battalion, Hampshire Regiment.SOUTHAMPTON NEWS .The Hampshire Advertiser (Southampton, England), Saturday, 28 January 1893; pg. 8; Issue 4866. 19th Century British Library Newspapers: Part II. After this he was a Canon Residentiary at Truro CathedralThe Times, Tuesday, 17 September 1895; pg. 10; Issue 34684; col G Ecclesiastical intelligence and Diocesan Missioner ECCLESIASTICAL APPOINTMENTS .The Standard (London, England), Friday, 20 September 1895; pg. 6; Issue 22221. 19th Century British Library Newspapers: Part II. until February 1902, when he was appointed Vicar of Brighton (and Chaplain to the 1st Sussex. Royal Garrison Artillery Volunteers).London Gazette He was then Archdeacon of Hastings from 1915 until 1920. He was Archdeacon of Chichester from 1920 to 1934 and a Residentiary Canon at its cathedral. He died on 11 September 1935.Death Of The Rev. B. G. Hoskyns The Times Friday, 13 September 1935; pg. 14; Issue 47168; col D His grandson, Sir John Leigh Austin Hungerford Hoskyns was head of the Prime Minister's Policy Unit from 1979The Times, Tuesday, 27 November 1979; pg. 2; Issue 60485; col F Inquiry into leak of Cabinet papers until 1982. ==Notes== Category:1856 births Category:Alumni of Jesus College, Cambridge Category:Archdeacons of Hastings Category:Archdeacons of Chichester Category:1935 deaths Category:Royal Army Chaplains' Department officers
title: Benedict Hoskyns
